revised_title: Crystallographic Shear and Non-Stoichiometry in Molybdenum Trioxide
tldr: The author investigates the formation of crystallographic shear planes in molybdenum trioxide, a type of non-stoichiometric compound. These shear planes are chemical defects that occur when oxygen atoms are removed from the structure. The density of these planes can describe the non-stoichiometric range MoO3_x (0 < x < 0.05). The author also discusses the mechanism of production of these shear planes and compares it with other models proposed in the literature.
